meanings.definition: To move quickly with short, hurried steps.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit would scutter across the field to reach its burrow.
meanings.sent2: I scuttered to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel would scutter around the tree, trying to find its hidden acorns.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to scutter by as I rushed to finish my homework.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves scutter along the pavement.

meanings.definition: A small, quick movement or sound.
meanings.sent1: I heard a scutter in the bushes and knew a small animal was nearby.
meanings.sent2: The scutter of the mouse could be heard in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The scutter of the falling pebbles startled the hiker.
meanings.sent4: The scutter of the beetle across the floor caught my attention.
meanings.sent5: The scutter of the pages turning filled the library.

meanings.definition: A small, quick, or light rain shower.
meanings.sent1: We decided to wait under the tree until the scutter passed.
meanings.sent2: The scutter outside was refreshing after the hot day.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected scutter caught us off guard during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The scutter left tiny puddles on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The scutter brought a rainbow as it cleared away.
